subject: Sexual Health
title: Semen Analysis Explained
description: A micro-lesson that makes Semen Analysis Explained usable.

hook.text: A semen analysis is the first and most important test for evaluating male fertility potential.

buildup.text: It measures sperm count, motility (how well they swim), and morphology (their shape and structure).

discovery.text: Normal count is 15 million or more per milliliter. Below that is considered low, or oligospermia.

twist.text: A single abnormal result does not mean infertility. Results vary, and doctors recommend testing twice.

climax.text: Semen analysis is simple, inexpensive, and provides crucial information for fertility evaluation.

punchline.text: Count, swim, shape. Three numbers that matter.

quiz.question: What is considered a normal sperm count?
